Description: Egyptian terracotta figure. 'Grotesque' style bald head, broken away from its separately made figure, probably male and perhaps a priest. At the base of the neck is a short tenon for insertion into its body. From a two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Naukratis (Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. G 107; Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, GR.40.1887; Walters 1903, C 625; Fischer 1994, no. 437; Bailey 2008: 151, pl. 106. no. 3573-3578, see British Museum GR1886,0401.1412, GR1886,0401.1427 ), but also 2nd century BC examples from Smyrna in Asia Minor (Burn & Higgins 2001: pl. 71-2, no. 2396-2404). 2nd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2000, Fig. 2). Mid to late 3rd century BC parallel from Hadra, Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, no. 182). Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale. Szymańska, H. 2000. Tell Atrib excavations, 1999. In PAM II: 77-82. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen: Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.514) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5850 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
